result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Barriere

defendant.name: Barriere, Christopher M.
defendant.address: N6197 Country View Lane, Sullivan, WI 53178

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 2:32pm 
Defendant Christopher M. Barriere in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner notes that he is newly appointed counsel; he requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference. 
recess 2:35pm

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on November 2nd at 8:30am, (2) Preliminary Hearing on November 22nd at 8:30am
Order on PFAC, repayment at the rate of $100 per month with the first payment due 11/15/22
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Christopher M. Barriere in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant indicates that he didn't qualify for SPD counsel because he got a new job a couple of weeks ago and requests court appointed counsel. 

Court directs that the defendant complete the application form before leaving today. Court reviews repayment expectations. 
Case continued for STC - 10/24/22 at 2:30pm. 
Recess 2:09pm. 

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
STC - 10/24/22 at 2:30pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 1:57pm 
Defendant Christopher M. Barriere appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Barriere declined to be evaluated by SPD

Mr. Barriere gives explanation for non appearance. 
The Court reinstates signature bond. 

Def. requests additional time to obtain counsel.
recess 2:03  pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/10/22 at 2:00pm (status of counsel?)

[ma] Case called at 1:54 PM 
Defendant Christopher M. Barriere not in court.  Attorney Melanie Flint in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Flint requests a body only, bench warrant based on the non appearance of Mr. Barriere. 

The Court authorizes a body only, bench warrant. 
recess: 1:57pm
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Conditions of Bond include: 
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no presence at In Good Spirits bar in Sullivan

[MK] case called at 1:41pm 
Defendant Christopher M Barriere appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD appears for bond-purposes only; Mr. Homann is not eligible for PD representation).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is addressed. Mr. Homann requests a sixty day adjournment to allow him time to raise funds; he intends to retain an attorney.
The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits.

The Court requires a $1,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no presence at In Good Spirits bar in Sullivan
recess 1:46pm. 

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status-of-counsel hearing) on September 15th at 1:15pm

Order to Seal Victim Key
